requirements.summary: Implement progressive speed increase mechanism where bird vertical velocity increases gradually during gameplay
acceptanceCriteria: Bird vertical velocity increases at regular intervals during active gameplay
Speed increase is noticeable but not jarring to gameplay experience
Speed resets to initial value when game restarts after collision

file_operations.description: Add progressive speed increase logic to the game state management. Introduce a speed multiplier state variable that increases at timed intervals during active gameplay. Apply the multiplier to the bird's vertical velocity calculations. Ensure the speed multiplier resets to 1.0 when the game restarts after a collision. Implement interval-based speed tier increases (e.g., every 10-15 seconds of gameplay). Maintain existing collision detection, jumping mechanics, and pipe generation while incorporating the speed scaling factor.

requirements.summary: Add visual feedback to indicate speed level changes with a speed multiplier indicator
acceptanceCriteria: Player can see current speed level or multiplier
Visual feedback appears when speed tier changes
Indicator does not obstruct core gameplay view

file_operations.description: Add a speed multiplier display component to the game UI showing the current speed level (e.g., '1.0x', '1.2x', '1.5x'). Position the indicator in a non-obstructive location (top-right or top-left corner). Implement a brief visual notification or highlight effect when the speed tier increases (e.g., a fade-in animation or color pulse). Style the indicator to be clearly visible but not distracting from the core gameplay area. Update the display whenever the speed multiplier changes.

Add CSS classes for the speed multiplier indicator styling, including positioning, typography, and animation effects for the speed tier change notification. Define a subtle pulse or glow animation that triggers when speed increases. Ensure the styling is consistent with the existing game theme and does not interfere with gameplay visibility.
